column4: Hello, again! has anyone of you ever had a problem with your CD drive not playing a music CD? the hardware is OK [I am sure of it], but the media player only returns the message ''not playing''
the cd is mounted? can you read the files on the cd? which format do they have?
I do not know whether it is mounted or not
i inserted the CD and the media player started, then stoped...
insert the cd in drive, close it. open a terminal and type there "mount"
I assumed that the CD drive would have been ''mounted'' when the system acknwoledged its existence by opening the media player...
yes, i think you are right. may you can open nautilus to look which files are on the cd
are there files on the cd like .ogg? or mp3?
ortsvorsteher:funny thing about that; the CD files should come up as .cda [I think] but in the Nautilus they are identified as .wma
no problem. may you open a terminal. type there "mount" please. look where youre cd is mounted
ok, but that try will have to be postponed until tomorrow, as I cannot restart my pc now [I have a dual-boot system and am using the WinXP OS at the moment...]
is that all I need to type: ''mount''?

okay. so come back when you need. no, not at all. mount shows you where the cd is mounted. cd to location of the cd. after you listed the files, you can look which format they are with "file music.wma"
thank you; I will be here tomorrow by this time; if necessary I will call on you again [I hope you wil not mind it]; o/
if i am here, no problem. :)
